issue.title: [CF 478] Colors don't support usable/unusable
issue.body:
pkuz
pkuz's avatar

    Posts: 16

Maybe "graying out" is not proper description, the icon is at 100% opacity but the colors are somewhat dim. Exactly like default blizzard bar has it when reactive ability is not available.

Here is the screenshot showing the problem along with some description:
http://i39.tinypic.com/351uwza.jpg

Cyb's rambling:
If new color options were added to also allow coloring based on usable/present/unusable/absent, then it would increase the number of color settings that need to be configured for each icon type from 4 to 8, which is a little bit out of hand. Not to mention that it overlaps heavily with the "Counting" color settings - reactive icons are one of the only icon types where the icon can be considered unusable and not counting at the same time. What I propose is this: (and it would fit in nicely with my new plans for separating out data handlers, removing the old :SetInfo method)

Have a data handler that takes everything that can affect appearance (alpha, usability/presence, duration (maybe?), out of mana, out of range) and deduce a color from that. Rewrite color settings to be more configurable - more like conditions where you can select your own requirements and set a color for those requirements. The color-getting function will go down the list in order, testing until it obtains a color.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras | Imported from CurseForge issue #478 | Raw
